description.narrative: Developing an effective multiple-use management framework for conserving biodiversity in the mountain landscape of the High Ranges, the Western Ghats, India.
first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Developing an effective multiple-use management framework for conserving biodiversity in the mountain landscape of the High Ranges, the western ghats, India

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Effective governance framework for multipleuse mountain landscape management in place
Effective and functioning crosssectoral multistakeholder institution including conservation livelihood and production established

comment.narrative: The project envisages the establishment of a multistakeholder institution with representation from all relevant sectors An appraisal will be done of the different models of governance institutions in the country and based on the recommendations of this appraisal the State will decide on teh nature of the institution Presently a Working Committee has been formed under the Chairmanship of the Addiitional Chief Secretary in the State which has representation of officials from all line departments and other relevant stakeholders

The project envisages the establishment of a multistakeholder institution with representation from all relevant sectors An appraisal will be done of the different models of governance institutions in the country and based on the recommendations of this appraisal the State will decide on teh nature of the institution Presently a Working Committee has been formed under the Chairmanship of the Addiitional Chief Secretary in the State which has representation of officials from all line departments and other relevant stakeholders

description.narrative: Landscape Level Land use Plan LLLUP developed adhering to multiple use management decisions

comment.narrative: Baseline studies have been commissioned to review sectoral plans and gather data which will help design the governance framework for a multiple landuse landscape this is a new area of work and there is very little experience in the country for this purpose The project is seeking guidance from other projects of similar nature in the country to learn and adapt

Baseline studies have been commissioned to review sectoral plans and gather data which will help design the governance framework for a multiple landuse landscape this is a new area of work and there is very little experience in the country for this purpose The project is seeking guidance from other projects of similar nature in the country to learn and adapt

description.narrative: Number of key policy and management framework decisions adopted at local and state level related to sustainable mountain landscape management

comment.narrative: 7 Wildlife Protection Act Forest Conservation Act Environment Protection Act Forest Rights Act Cardamom Rules KDH Act Land Assignment Act Commodities Act National Working Plan Code and other Management decisions

The project will commission a study in year 2 to review in details all legal and policy matters related to the objective of the project Field activities and demonstration interventions will inform relevant policies

7 Wildlife Protection Act Forest Conservation Act Environment Protection Act Forest Rights Act Cardamom Rules KDH Act Land Assignment Act Commodities Act National Working Plan Code and other Management decisions

description.narrative: Sectorspecific biodiversityplans compatible with LLLUP developed leading to effective integration of biodiversity considerations into production practices

comment.narrative: At least six Sector Plans Forestry Tourism Tea Cardamom Agriculture and Tribal Development and Biodiversity Conservation Plans 5 in place

Studies will be commissioned in year two to ascertain the opportunities within the sectoral plans to incorporate biodiversity friendly practices and principles in sectoral plans and also align these with the Landscape level plan
At least six Sector Plans Forestry Tourism Tea Cardamom Agriculture and Tribal Development and Biodiversity Conservation Plans 5 in place

Studies will be commissioned in year two to ascertain the opportunities within the sectoral plans to incorporate biodiversity friendly practices and principles in sectoral plans and also align these with the Landscape level plan

description.narrative: Improved management effectiveness PAs as measured and recorded by Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool METT

comment.narrative: 168 out of 300

Increase in METT scores by 10 percent by year 3
By 20 percent by year 5

The Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool has not been exercised during this period This indicator will be assessed only at the 3rd and 5th year as the project is yet to start in the field Hence this indicator cannot be considered at this stage

description.narrative: To protect biodiversity of the High Range Mountain Landscape of the southern Western Ghats in peninsular India from existing and emergent threats through building an effective collaborative governance framework for multiple use management
Extent brought under multiple use management planning framework

comment.narrative: 0 ha

This project covers an area of 3000 000 ha in the landscape Studies have been commissioned to review the sectoral planning and governance system in the landscape The data gathered in the first two years of the project will provide the basis for developing a collaborative framework on multipleuse management of this landscape

This project covers an area of 3000 000 ha in the landscape Studies have been commissioned to review the sectoral planning and governance system in the landscape The data gathered in the first two years of the project will provide the basis for developing a collaborative framework on multipleuse management of this landscape

description.narrative:
Population status of following critical species remain stable or increases
Nilgiri tahr
Grizzled giant squirrel
Tiger

comment.narrative: Remain stable or increases by project end

Periodic wildlife estimation are done by the State Forest Department
Nilgiri tahr estimation done in March 2015 indicates a population of 900 in the project area
Estimated population of Grizzled Giant Squirrel GGS during 201314 in Chinnar WLS indicates 2442 individualskm2 Since the methodology used during baseline survey and the recent estimates are different total count method vs density estimates through transect method the figures could not be compared However the population of GGS remains stable in Chinnar WLS
Tiger estimation done in Nov 2014 indicates a total population of 136 tigers in the State which is shown to be a substantial increase in the population the estimated population of tigers in the State during 2010 is 71 Landscapelevel estimation carried out in 2010 has not been attempted in 2014 hence exact figures of tigers in the landscape cannot be given
Remain stable or increases by project end

Periodic wildlife estimation are done by the State Forest Department
Nilgiri tahr estimation done in March 2015 indicates a population of 900 in the project area
Estimated population of Grizzled Giant Squirrel GGS during 201314 in Chinnar WLS indicates 2442 individualskm2 Since the methodology used during baseline survey and the recent estimates are different total count method vs density estimates through transect method the figures could not be compared However the population of GGS remains stable in Chinnar WLS
Tiger estimation done in Nov 2014 indicates a total population of 136 tigers in the State which is shown to be a substantial increase in the population the estimated population of tigers in the State during 2010 is 71 Landscapelevel estimation carried out in 2010 has not been attempted in 2014 hence exact figures of tigers in the landscape cannot be given

description.narrative: Improvements in water quality in the water bodies of the landscape

comment.narrative: BOD 15 mgl at Neriamangalamand 14 mgl at Bhoothathankett
10 improvement by project end

Study has been commissioned to assess the current quality of the water in the water bodies in the landscape The study is also identifying good practices including traditional practices in water conservation in the state Interventions from project will be decided by the Technical Commitee based on the recommendations emanating from this study
10 improvement by project end

Study has been commissioned to assess the current quality of the water in the water bodies in the landscape The study is also identifying good practices including traditional practices in water conservation in the state Interventions from project will be decided by the Technical Commitee based on the recommendations emanating from this study

description.narrative: Extent brought under multiple use management planning framework

comment.narrative: 0 ha

1. Comprehensive plan for “Green Munnar” and "Athirappilly Panchayat" to be developed for decentralised solid waste management 2. Integrated Watershed Management Plans developed for 11 Gram Panchayats 3. Exotic Plants and invasive alien species will be removed for restoration of degraded habitats within the Protected Areas in Munnar 4. Technology based solutions to be identified for reducing fuel wood consumption in different productions sectors like tea, cardamom, coffee etc. 5. Inception workshop to be conducted to orient all relevant stakeholders

1. A comprehensive plan for "Green Munnar" and "Athirappilly Panchayat" developed for decentralised solid waste management 2. Integrated Watershed Management Plans are in the process of development for 11 Gram Panchayats in Kerala 3. Exotic plants and invasive alien species have been removed in 20 hectares of land in Eravikulam National Park 4. Artificial Intelligence based technology developed for waste management and technology based solutions identified for lemongrass distillation 5. Inception workshop successfully organized for all relevant stakeholders

1. Green Accelerator Lab Initiative launched and operationalised for identification of innovators for mainstreaming biodiversity considerations 2. Demonstrate pilots for effective waste management in 3 Panchayats 3. Demonstrate innovative solutions for conservation of Giant Grizzled squirrel within the Protected Areas 4. Analyse gaps in production sectors for mainstreaming biodiversity - Tea, Forestry, Cardamom etc. 5. Identify atleast 2 value chains and plans developed for diversification of livelihoods of local communities through value addition

1. Green Accelerator Lab Initiative anchored under the Kerala Start Up Mission was launched by the Hon'ble Finance Minister, Government of Kerala for promoting innovations in the area of biodiversity conservation and sustainable natural resource management 2. Restoration measures were undertaken for securing the population of the Giant Grizzled Squirrel. Tree ladders have been put across 14 locations in the Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary, Kerala to protect the species from road kills. 3. Gaps analysed and recommendations placed for mainstreaming biodiversity considerations in production sector (Tea, Cardamom, Forestry, Tourism and Agriculture) 4. 4 value chains identified ( passion fruit, lemon grass, NTFP products, millets) and plans developed for diversification of livelihoods of local communities through value addition 5. Systems put in place for decentralized waste management in 6 Panchayats in Munnar landscape

1. Project Management Units (PMUs) to be established at national, state and landscape levels 2. Implementation and fund flow arrangements to be finalized 3. Annual Work Plans (AWPs) to be finalized for all project states 4. Studies and assessments commissioned to establish baselines as per the Project Results Framework

1. Project Management Units established at state and landscape level to support the State Government in effective implementation of the project 2. Green Kerala Mission entrusted as implementing agency for the project by the State Government of Kerala 3. Annual Work Plan approved by the national project steering committee of the project 4.Technical government institutions engaged for conducting baseline studies
